title: Burnham Overy Staithe to Holkham Beach Walk Route

images.title: Boats at Burnham Overy Staithe by Chris Holifield, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Boats at Burnham Overy Staithe

images.title: Elliott Brown, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tower Windmill. Grade II* listed windmill.

images.title: Boats at Burnham Overy Staithe by Derek Harper, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Boats at Burnham Overy Staithe

images.title: Zorba the Geek / Geese landing on open water
images.caption: Geese landing on open water. Heralded by much honking from the water and from the air, another group of geese land on this water on Overy Marshes, close to Burnham Overy Staithe. Marsh House Farm is in the group of trees in the background.

images.title: Ian Lavender / Burnham Overy Mill
images.caption: Burnham Overy Mill. A disused water mill -about 1km from Burnham Overy Staithe - this property is owned by the National Trust who let bits out as self catering flats.

images.title: Dune slack, Burnham Overy Dunes by Hugh Venables, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dune slack, Burnham Overy Dunes

images.title: Nigel Stickells / Burnham Harbour from the Dunes looking North-east
images.caption: Burnham Harbour from the Dunes looking North-east. Despite its name, Burnham Harbour is a natural feature and not a conventional man-made harbour. The harbour is an attractive unspoilt stretch of the River Burn that runs through the golden sands parallel to the coast.

images.title: Nigel Stickells / Shoreline at Burrow Gap in Holkham Bay
images.caption: Shoreline at Burrow Gap in Holkham Bay

description: This pretty village is located on the north coast of Norfolk, between Burnham Market and Wells Next the Sea. The village includes a lovely secluded beach, a harbour, salt marshes, creeks, sand dunes and a picturesque old mill. This walk from the village takes you east along the Peddars Way and Norfolk Coast Path to Holkham Beach where there is a National Nature Reserve. The walk can be extended by heading south to visit Holkham Park . The expansive park includes woodland, a lake and a deer park with miles of footpaths to try.
